trans-unit.source: Provides a means to specify the source of a binding in terms of a relative relationship in the run-time object graph.
trans-unit.target: Provides a means to specify the source of a binding in terms of a relative relationship in the run-time object graph.

trans-unit.source: RelativeSource markup extension
trans-unit.target: RelativeSource markup extension

trans-unit.source: {RelativeSource} markup extension
trans-unit.target: {RelativeSource} markup extension

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Provides a means to specify the source of a binding in terms of a relative relationship in the run-time object graph.
trans-unit.target: Provides a means to specify the source of a binding in terms of a relative relationship in the run-time object graph.

trans-unit.source: XAML attribute usage (Self mode)
trans-unit.target: XAML attribute usage (Self mode)

trans-unit.source: XAML attribute usage (TemplatedParent mode)
trans-unit.target: XAML attribute usage (TemplatedParent mode)

trans-unit.source: XAML values
trans-unit.target: XAML values

trans-unit.source: | Term | Description | | {RelativeSource Self} | Produces a [Mode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209915) value is Self.
trans-unit.target: | Term | Description | | {RelativeSource Self} | Produces a [Mode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209915) value is Self.

trans-unit.source: The target element should be used as the source for this binding.
trans-unit.target: The target element should be used as the source for this binding.

trans-unit.source: This is useful for binding one property of an element to another property on the same element.
trans-unit.target: This is useful for binding one property of an element to another property on the same element.

trans-unit.source: | | {RelativeSource TemplatedParent} | Produces a [ControlTemplate](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209391) is applied is the source for this binding.
trans-unit.target: | | {RelativeSource TemplatedParent} | Produces a [ControlTemplate](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209391) is applied is the source for this binding.

trans-unit.source: This is useful for applying runtime information to bindings at the template level.
trans-unit.target: This is useful for applying runtime information to bindings at the template level.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: A [**Binding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209820) can set [**Binding.RelativeSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209831) either as an attribute on a **Binding** object element or as a component within a [{Binding} markup extension](binding-markup-extension.md).
trans-unit.target: A [**Binding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209820) can set [**Binding.RelativeSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209831) either as an attribute on a **Binding** object element or as a component within a [{Binding} markup extension](binding-markup-extension.md).

trans-unit.source: This is why two different XAML syntaxes are shown.
trans-unit.target: This is why two different XAML syntaxes are shown.

trans-unit.source: **RelativeSource** is similar to [{Binding} markup extension](binding-markup-extension.md) in that it is a markup extension that is capable of returning instances of itself, supporting a string-based construction that essentially passes an argument to the constructor.
trans-unit.target: **RelativeSource** is similar to [{Binding} markup extension](binding-markup-extension.md) in that it is a markup extension that is capable of returning instances of itself, supporting a string-based construction that essentially passes an argument to the constructor.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the argument being passed is the [**Mode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209915) value.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the argument being passed is the [**Mode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209915) value.

trans-unit.source: The **Self** mode is useful for cases where the same element should be used as the source object and target object for a binding, but different properties are the source and the target.
trans-unit.target: The **Self** mode is useful for cases where the same element should be used as the source object and target object for a binding, but different properties are the source and the target.

trans-unit.source: This is useful for binding one property of an element to another property on the same element, and is a variation on [**ElementName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209828) binding that does not require naming and then self-referencing the element.
trans-unit.target: This is useful for binding one property of an element to another property on the same element, and is a variation on [**ElementName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209828) binding that does not require naming and then self-referencing the element.

trans-unit.source: If you bind one property of an element to another property on the same element, either the properties must use the same property type, or you must also use a [**Converter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209826) on the binding to convert the values.
trans-unit.target: If you bind one property of an element to another property on the same element, either the properties must use the same property type, or you must also use a [**Converter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209826) on the binding to convert the values.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could use [**Height**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208718) as a source for [**Width**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208751) without conversion, but you'd need a converter to use [**IsEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209419) as a source for [**Visibility**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209006).
trans-unit.target: For example, you could use [**Height**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208718) as a source for [**Width**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208751) without conversion, but you'd need a converter to use [**IsEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209419) as a source for [**Visibility**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209006).

trans-unit.source: Here's an example.
trans-unit.target: Here's an example.

trans-unit.source: This [**Rectangle**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243371) uses a [{Binding} markup extension](binding-markup-extension.md) so that its [**Height**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208718) and [**Width**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208751) are always equal and it renders as a square.
trans-unit.target: This [**Rectangle**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243371) uses a [{Binding} markup extension](binding-markup-extension.md) so that its [**Height**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208718) and [**Width**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208751) are always equal and it renders as a square.

trans-unit.source: Only the Height is set as a fixed value.
trans-unit.target: Only the Height is set as a fixed value.

trans-unit.source: For this **Rectangle** its default [**DataContext**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208713) is **null**, not **this**.
trans-unit.target: For this **Rectangle** its default [**DataContext**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208713) is **null**, not **this**.

trans-unit.source: So to establish the data context source to be the object itself (and enable binding to its other properties) we use the `RelativeSource={RelativeSource Self}` argument in the {Binding} markup extension usage.
trans-unit.target: So to establish the data context source to be the object itself (and enable binding to its other properties) we use the `RelativeSource={RelativeSource Self}` argument in the {Binding} markup extension usage.

trans-unit.source: Another technique that can be useful is to use `RelativeSource={RelativeSource Self}` as a way to set an object's [**DataContext**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208713) to itself, where the [**Page**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227503) class has been extended with a custom property that's already providing a ready-to-go view model for its own data binding.
trans-unit.target: Another technique that can be useful is to use `RelativeSource={RelativeSource Self}` as a way to set an object's [**DataContext**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208713) to itself, where the [**Page**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227503) class has been extended with a custom property that's already providing a ready-to-go view model for its own data binding.

trans-unit.source: You see this technique in some of the SDK examples:
trans-unit.target: You see this technique in some of the SDK examples:

trans-unit.source: **Note** The XAML usage for **RelativeSource** shows only the usage for which it is intended: setting a value for [**Binding.RelativeSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209831) in XAML as part of a binding expression.
trans-unit.target: **Note** The XAML usage for **RelativeSource** shows only the usage for which it is intended: setting a value for [**Binding.RelativeSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209831) in XAML as part of a binding expression.

trans-unit.source: Theoretically, other usages are possible if setting a property where the value is [**RelativeSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209913).
trans-unit.target: Theoretically, other usages are possible if setting a property where the value is [**RelativeSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209913).
